results.title: Mickey's trailer
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Gang’s All Here”.
Mickey, Donald and Goofy go for a holiday in Mickey’s trailer. When the trailer becomes unhooked some hair-raising adventures follow. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Mickey's orphans
results.brief_description: Mickey, Minnie and Pluto are preparing for Christmas when a stranger drops a litter of mischievous kittens on the doorstep. Always the naive generous type, Mickey takes them in and they predictably run rampant, a path of misery and destruction cut through the very soul of middle America while making its children laugh!

results.title: Mickey's Christmas carol
results.brief_description: Mickey’s Christmas Carol features Scrooge McDuck as the miserly Ebenezer Scrooge, Goofy as a rather accident-prone ghost of Jacob Marley; Jiminy Cricket as the ghost of Christmas Past, and a host of other Disney favourites! It’s all the magic of Disney animation in an enchanting new version of the world’s best-loved Christmas fantasy. Rated: G

results.title: Mickey
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Rare film footage of Walt Disney introduces the long and charming life of the greatest cartoon character of them all - Mickey Mouse. Mickey started life as Mortimer, but the name just didn’t seem to fit! Instead, he became Mickey Mouse for his show business premiere on November 18, 1928. Mickey’s screen debut was in the first animated cartoon to feature synchronised sound: “Steamboat Willie”. In addition to Mickey’s first film role, this collection also includes some of his greatest adventures highlighted in a career that has spanned over 55 years. Titles include “Steamboat Willie”, “Mickey’s grand opera” and “Symphony hour”, all classics in their own right.

results.title: Mick and the moon
results.brief_description: A biography of Mick Numierie Jabaljari, an Aboriginal painter. Deals with the beliefs of the Central Australian Aboriginals concerning the moon, sun and the wind. Commentary by David Gulpilil and Tony Barry.

results.title: Michelangelo and his art
results.brief_description: The life and career of Michelangelo, sculptor, painter, architect and poet, whose knowledge of the human body and skill in portraying human emotion throughout the body make him one of the greatest artists and a leading figure of the Italian Renaissance. Original works shown and discussed are “David”, the “Pieta”, “Moses”, the figures of the Medici chapel, and the “Deposition”.

results.title: Michael Palin: Sahara [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Paul Davidson, Roger Mills and BBC
results.brief_description: Michael Palin continues his travel series, this time taking an exacting journey a thousand miles across the Sahara Desert. Starting at Gibraltar, Palin travels from Maraksesh, Morocco, to Mauritania, Fez, Mali, Zouerat, Timbuktu, Senegal, Niger, Algeria, Libya and Tunisia. Palin makes for an amusing guide as he witnesses an array of exotic and fascinating cultural mores, some dating back many centuries. Traversing desert, sand dunes, rivers and oases, Palin and his crew survey some amazing and incredible sights where ancient cultures clash with modern concerns of trade and post-Colonial life. Documenting some quite spectacular scenery, Palin meets many hospitable and intriguing people from diverse cultural backgrounds. Amidst other adventures he travels on the world’s longest train - an iron ore express in Mauritania, interviews a competitor in the Paris-Dakar rally, visits Goree Island where the black slaves from Africa were taken, meets the unique Dogong people, goes to Timbuktu and even visits the place where “The Life of Brian” was filmed. Part of Palin’s appeal is his obvious genuine interest in people from different cultures and his ability to ingratiate himself with locals, share dinner or a drink and discuss their way of life, which makes for an interesting, enlightening and entertaining series.

results.title: Michael Palin: Himalaya
results.creator_credit: John Paul Davidson, Roger Mills and BBC
results.brief_description: Travel with Michael Palin as he stars, writes and narrates this fascinating travel adventure across the Khyber Pass, through the Himalya finishing at the Bay of Bengal - a journey over 2000 miles. Documenting some quite spectacular scenery, Palin meets many hospitable and intriguing people from diverse cultural backgrounds - he is even granted an interview with the Dalai Lama. We learn in a pre-trip interview that at sixty years of age Palin is somewhat nervous at the prospect of this adventure but still excited by the idea of discovering new places, none of which he has been to before - quite a feat as this is his sixth televised international journey. A six part television series complete on three DVDs, the set contains over 90 minutes of extra footage.

results.title: Michael Palin's Hemingway adventure
results.creator_credit: David F. Turnbull, Martha Wailes and BBC
results.brief_description: In the tradition of previous work of Palin’s that includes “Around the World in Eighty Days” and “Pole to Pole”, this is a beautifully filmed and cleverly narrated documentary which traces Palin’s journey in the footsteps of American writer Ernest Hemingway. In his attempts to experience Hemingway’s adventures things don’t always work quite as planned, but the result is always humourous and insightful both on the contradictory literary giant and the impact of the diversity of sights Palin visits. His tour includes such attractions as the fireworks of Valencia, the streets of Paris, the outback of Uganda and the snows of Kilimanjaro that feature in Hemingway’s work. Palin’s mastery of narrational comedy and Nigel Meakin’s skilled camerawork makes this a highly energetic travelogue.
